Introduction to ASURAT (version 0.0.0.9000) Keita Iida 2021-06-04 Chapter 1 Overview ASURAT is a single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) data analysis pipeline, developed for simultaneously clustering single-cell transcriptomes and biological interpretation. Inputting an scRNA-seq data and knowledge-based databases (DBs), ASURAT creates lists of biological terms with respect to cell type and biological functions. Then, ASURAT creates a functional spectrum matrix. By analyzing this matrix, users can cluster samples (or cells) to aid their interpretation. 1.1 License and description Package: ASURAT Title: Functional annotation-driven unsupervised clustering of scRNA-seq data Version: 0.0.0.9000 Authors@R: person("Keita", "Iida", email = "kiida@protein.osaka-u.ac.jp", role = c("aut", "cre")) Description: In single-cell transcriptomics ASURAT assists users to cluster samples (or cells) in biologically explainable manners and find various types of biological terms specifically upregulated in each cluster. Using ASURAT, users can create and analyze a special type of matrix termed "sign-by-sample matrix", of which the rows and columns stand for biological terms and samples, respectively.
